intro: Leucas macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved leucas, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are large, lance-shaped, and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. The flowers appear in clusters and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds.
